meanings.sent1: The park was full of rubbishes left behind by picnickers.
meanings.sent2: Please remember to dispose of your rubbishes in the designated bins.
meanings.sent3: The raccoon thought the rubbishes were treasures to explore.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was cluttered with emotional rubbishes she needed to clear out.
meanings.sent5: The ocean waves carried various rubbishes to the shore.

meanings.sent1: She rubbishes every idea that is not her own.
meanings.sent2: It is not polite to constantly rubbishes others' efforts.
meanings.sent3: He playfully rubbishes his friend's taste in music.
meanings.sent4: The politician rubbishes his opponent's policies in every speech.
meanings.sent5: The teacher never rubbishes her students' attempts to learn.

meanings.sent1: The garage sale was full of rubbishes that no one wanted.
meanings.sent2: One man's treasure is another man's rubbishes.
meanings.sent3: The child's toy box was a mix of treasures and rubbishes.
meanings.sent4: She realized her collection of old books were just rubbishes to others.
meanings.sent5: The attic was a graveyard of forgotten rubbishes.
